abstract.p: Cristina Teuscher wins four events at USA Challenge Swim Series in East Meadow, NY (S)

block.p: Cristina Teuscher, a 1996 Olympic gold medalist from New Rochelle, N.Y., capped a dominating weekend last night at the USA Challenge Swim Series in East Meadow, N.Y., by winning her fourth event. She took the 200-meter individual medley by more than five seconds in 2 minutes 15.70 seconds.

Teuscher won the 200 freestyle and 400 individual medley in meet-record time on Saturday after taking the 100 freestyle on Friday. She was also third to the former Olympian Lea Loveless Maurer in the 200 backstroke on Friday. Maurer took her specialty at 100 meters last night in 1:02.33.

Cristina Teuscher, a 1996 Olympic gold medalist from New Rochelle, N.Y., capped a dominating weekend last night at the USA Challenge Swim Series in East Meadow, N.Y., by winning her fourth event. She took the 200-meter individual medley by more than five seconds in 2 minutes 15.70 seconds.

Teuscher won the 200 freestyle and 400 individual medley in meet-record time on Saturday after taking the 100 freestyle on Friday. She was also third to the former Olympian Lea Loveless Maurer in the 200 backstroke on Friday. Maurer took her specialty at 100 meters last night in 1:02.33.
Michael Phelps also scored an individual medley double, winning the 200 in 2:05.54 after winning the 400 on Saturday.
Ricardo Montesterio, already qualified for Venezuela's Olympic team for the second straight time, easily won the 1,500 freestyle in a meet-record 15:30.85.
The United States Olympic trials are Aug. 9-16 in Indianapolis.
